news_header: Sweden plans to enhance school safety by introducing new laws that will allow increased camera surveillance, inspections of students' belongings, and stricter security measures, following the Örebro massacre. These laws will apply to various educational institutions and are expected to take effect in July.
news_original_title: Ruotsin koulut saavat jatkossa tutkia oppilaiden reput
news_text: The government is also tightening emergency school plans and has already restricted certain semi-automatic weapons.
